captions.text:
• From third nipples on celebrities to unborn
siblings growing limbs all over your chest

and back, we count 15 of the most bizarre
appendages ever to sprout on the human body

15 - The Two-Headed Baby
• These two boys were born from a 25 year

old Brazilian woman: Maria de Nazare
• The twins shared the same lungs, liver,

heart and pelvis - but with two individual
brains and spine columns

• The director of Santa Casa hospital advised
the mother that removing or separating the

heads wasn't an option since both brains were
functioning and independent, but simply shared

their body
• So she called them Emanoel and Jesus,

in tribute of the fabled religious figures
14 - The Spider Girl

• India, 1970, two conjoined twins are born
Ganga and Jamuna Mondal sharing 4 arms, 3

legs (2 of which are working), two hearts,
two kidneys, one liver, one sexual organ and

stomach
• But they got their name Spider Girl working

at the Dreamland Circus showing off their
daily routine to people, and the way they

walked just as a two-headed spider would
13 - Mark Wahlberg

• The well-known actor has a third nipple
on the left side of his chest

• He considered getting it removed when
he initially started acting work, but with

time he came to accept it as a part of him
• Only fewer than 2% of Earth's population

have these, likely more since they're commonly
mistaken for moles on the armpit or groin

12 - The Two-bodied Girl
• These were extra limbs and body parts

inherited by accident
• In the womb, Lakshmi Tatma had a parasitic

twin that stopped developing halfway through,
and so she absorbed the other twins body parts

into her own
• Thus, she was born with 4 arms, 4 legs,

another kidney, stomach, chest cavity and
nerves

• Doctors decided to remove all these extraneous
body parts in a $625,000 dollar operation

that took 27 hours to complete
11 - The Horned Woman

• This is from a 101 year old woman from
China, Zhang Ruifang, who sprouted a goat

horn on the left side of her forehead
• Soon after, another began growing on the

other side
• The horn grew to two inches in size, made

of keratin the same material found in fingernails
and IS technically removable with a sterile

razor - though since it is a type of tumor
you'd still need to treat the underlying cause

or chances are it'd grow back
10 - Two-faced Baby

• This is known as transverse facial cleft,
and the cause is unknown, but the babies face

literally lifted off the skull to form a fleshy
mask

• The story goes the baby's mother begged
and pleaded to see what happened after birth,

but the husband wouldn't let her until she
finally managed to see the problem - and she

broke down in tears
• It cost around 100,000 dollars to fix

but, thankfully, the baby was successfully
treated at the People's Liberation Army's

Military Hospital
9 - The Spine Fetus

• This chinese girl was born with a tiny
undeveloped fetus planted firmly on her back

• They left it there for a long time until,
when she turned 11, it got to a point where

the fetus had developed so clearly that you
could see arms and legs

• In the end, her parents opted for surgery
and the fetus was successfully removed from

her back
8 - The Three-Legged Man

• 1844, Germany, George Lippet carried with
him a third leg and, strangely enough, a second

heart though this was unknown until he autopsy
over 60 years later

• It was in his early career that he became
known as the three-legged man alongside his

three-legged rival Fancesco Lentini, who lived
a long successful life

• Lippet couldn't actually use his third
leg though, however he does claim that it

WAS functional before a bad fracture
7 - Extra fingers and toes

• A six-year-old boy who sported 15 fingers
and 16 toes, which broke the previous record

of 25 digits with his 31
• However, the boy had his digits reduced

to the standard 20 in an operation that took
5 hours to complete

• So now he can wear normal shoes and perhaps
even use chopsticks given time

6 - The Umbilical Cord Finger
• This one was man-made, a twenty year old

furniture maker, Wang Yongjun who lost the
top of his finger to an electric saw

• The doctor in charge of saving the finger
had to make a snap decision - restore blood

flow or lose the entire digit
• So he made a faux umbilical cord from

Wang's stomach to his missing fingertip to
restore that blood flow and regenerate a new

finger
• And somehow, it should work!

5 - The Boy with a Body Coming from his Chest
• 2010, a seven-year-old Indian Boy, Deepak

Paswan born with four legs and four arms from
a parasitic womb twin

• Hindu pilgrims visited his home to worship
him as an incarnation of the god Vishnu, which

made his family uncomfortable, so they decided
to take him to Bangalore to have the limbs

removed
• It was a four hour operation - and a successful

one
• He now lives with no additional limbs

and a wicked scar on his chest
4 - The Extra Arm

• 2006, Shanghai, a baby is born with a
fully developed third arm

• The problem was: which arm do you remove?
Both are in the correct spot, you can't keep

one because then you wouldn't be able to use
either

• Eventually the doctors decided to remove
the arm laid across his chest since it couldn't

fully extend, but the arm they left had no
palm and it needed intensive physical therapy

to make it move properly
3 - The Woman with Two Vaginas

• Hazel Jones, it wasn't until she was 18
years of age that her boyfriend at the time

noticed something unusual with her pelvis
• She consulted the doctor who told her

she had two separate uteruses and cervixes
inside one hole

• This meant, since there were two vaginal
chasms, she had to lose her virginity twice,

though she has to deal with cramps and intense
periods each month

2 - The DNA kid
• This is a two-year-old boy, and at the

time he was the only known kid in the world
to have an extra strand in his DNA

• Unfortunately he was born blind and with
disabilities, and doctors were so baffled

by the discovery that nobody knows what to
even name the condition

• What this means for science and humankind
is still unclear, though all signs point to

a standard mutation, but a unique one at that
1 - Extra head

• A bit of a tragic story for Manar Mohamed,
where a sibling was conjoined at the head

to her sister
• The second head was fully functional,

with its own brain and motor skills, but it
fed off Manar's organs to the point of heart

failure
• The only prognosis was removal of the

extra head, which should have killed both
of them, but miraculously, Manar survived
- though at the cost of her undeveloped sister

title: 15 People with Extra Limbs & Body Parts
